data.title: 5 Bronx Authors Everyone Needs to Read — The Bronx is Reading
data.meta_description: Here are five Bronx authors that everyone needs to read featuring Liliam Rivera, Gabby RIvera, Roya Marsh, Raven Leilani and more.
data.text:
Never Look Back by Lilliam Rivera

NEVER LOOK BACK tells the story of Eury arriving in the Bronx as a haunted girl. Haunted by losing everything in Hurricane Maria and by an evil spirit, Ato. She hopes that the tragedy that befell her and her family in Puerto Rico doesn’t reach her in New York. She can almost put aside the fear she feels upon meeting a boy named Pheus.

Here's to Us by Adam Silvera and Becky Albertalli

Arthur is in New York for a dream internship on Broadway, with a boyfriend back home who he couldn't be happier with. But when he finds Ben snuggling up with a mystery boy, he begins to wonder if his feelings for Ben really went away. Ben has spent his first year of college working on his fantasy manuscript with his writing partner Mario, who is a great Spanish tutor, and an even better kisser.

Luster by Raven Leilani

Twenty-three-year-old Edie, a Black woman, meets Eric, a Forty-six-year-old white man in an open marriage. Edie accompanies Eric to Six Flags for their first date,though she is left unsatisfied, her date with Eric leads her to begin painting again after a two-year hiatus.

DayliGht: Poems by Roya Marsh

DayliGht by Roya Marsh is a collection of poems that talk about the intersections of femininity, weirdness, and blackness. This book has very powerful poems that you’re going to fall for, Give it a try.

Juliet Takes a Breath by Gabby Rivera

JULIET TAKES A BREATH, tells us the story of Julietwho, after coming out to her family, doesn't know if her mother will speak to her again. Unsure whether or not her mother will accept her, she flies to Portland, Oregon to intern with her favorite feminist writer, for what is sure to be a life-changing experience.
